content: The Act may be cited as the "Advance Fee Loan Scam Prevention Act of 1993". It amends Title 18. The "Advance Fee Loan Scam Prevention Act of 1993" amends Chapter 47 of title 18, United States Code by adding a new section, Sec. 1033, which prohibits loan brokers from soliciting advance fees for arranging consumer credit, making false representations, or engaging in fraudulent conduct in connection with their services. The "Advance Fee Loan Scam Prevention Act of 1993" prohibits loan brokers from soliciting advance fees for arranging consumer credit, making false representations, or engaging in fraudulent conduct. Violators may face fines, imprisonment up to 5 years, or both. Violations are treated as FTC rule violations and can be enforced by the FTC.
